card.name: Accursed Centaur
card.ability: When Accursed Centaur enters the battlefield, sacrifice a creature.
card.flavor:
"The Cabal mocks the natural order. For its minions, death is just a pause between duties."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If Accursed Centaur is the only creature on the battlefield, you must sacrifice it.

card.name: Æther Charge
card.ability: Whenever a Beast enters the battlefield under your control, you may have it deal 4 damage to target opponent.
card.flavor: "Is it just me, or does that meteor have teeth?"

card.name: Aggravated Assault
card.ability: {3}{R}{R}: Untap all creatures you control. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you have enough mana, the ability may be activated more than once in a turn.
10/4/2004 : You will normally use this during your post-combat main phase so you can untap any creatures that attacked.

card.name: Airborne Aid
card.ability: Draw a card for each Bird on the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"We help our Southern Order comrades as much as we can. But the Cabal's insidious influence spreads, dividing our forces and leaving new arrivals to fend for themselves."
—Commander Eesha

card.name: Airdrop Condor
card.ability:
Flying
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin creature: Airdrop Condor deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target creature or player.
card.flavor: It has two kinds of droppings, neither of which is particularly pleasant.

card.name: Akroma's Blessing
card.ability:
Choose a color. Creatures you control gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.
Cycling {W} ({W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: The clerics saw her as a divine gift. She saw them only as allies in her war against Phage.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Akroma's Vengeance
card.ability:
Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: Ixidor had only to imagine their ruin and Akroma made it so.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Ancestor's Prophet
card.ability: Tap five untapped Clerics you control: You gain 10 life.
card.flavor: "We have faced horrors of war and terrors beyond imagining. We will overcome the uncertainties of this new life."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since the ability does not have the {Tap} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
10/4/2004 : It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

card.name: Animal Magnetism
card.ability: Reveal the top five cards of your library. An opponent chooses a creature card from among them. Put that card onto the battlefield and the rest into your graveyard.

card.name: Annex
card.ability:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
You control enchanted land.
card.flavor: Most refugees left their ancestral homes behind when they came to Otaria. A few decided to bring them along.

card.name: Anurid Murkdiver
card.ability: Swampwalk
card.flavor: Aphetto's swamps are alive with the dead.

card.name: Aphetto Alchemist
card.ability:
{T}: Untap target artifact or creature.
Morph {U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: He brews trouble.

card.name: Aphetto Dredging
card.ability: Return up to three target creature cards of the creature type of your choice from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Phage became both executioner and savior, helping others to the same rebirth she had found.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You need to choose the creature type before choosing the targets.

card.name: Aphetto Grifter
card.ability: Tap two untapped Wizards you control: Tap target permanent.
card.flavor: Aphetto con artists started working in pairs to make it less likely they'd be the victims of con artists.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since the ability does not have the {Tap} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
10/4/2004 : It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

card.name: Aphetto Vulture
card.ability:
Flying
When Aphetto Vulture dies, you may put target Zombie card from your graveyard on top of your library.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability can be used to return itself to the top of your library if it is still in your graveyard when the ability resolves.

card.name: Arcanis the Omnipotent
card.ability:
{T}: Draw three cards.
{2}{U}{U}: Return Arcanis the Omnipotent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: He has journeyed where none have been before. Now he returns to ensure that none follow.

card.name: Artificial Evolution
card.ability: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one creature type with another. The new creature type can't be Wall. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a creature's creature type has been changed by a spell or ability, changing the card's text won't affect or alter the new creature type.
10/4/2004 : Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
10/4/2004 : Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
10/4/2004 : It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
10/4/2004 : It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
10/4/2004 : You choose the words to change on resolution.
10/4/2004 : You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".
10/4/2004 : Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
10/4/2004 : If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.

card.name: Ascending Aven
card.ability:
Flying
Ascending Aven can block only creatures with flying.
Morph {2}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Astral Slide
card.ability: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may exile target creature. If you do, return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor:
"The hum of the universe is never off-key."
—Mystic elder
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a player cycles a card during the end of turn step, the creature that is exiled won't come back until the end of the next turn.
8/1/2008 : If a face-down card is exiled, it turns face-up and remains face-up when it returns to the battlefield. This does not trigger any abilities that would trigger on it being turned face-up

card.name: Aura Extraction
card.ability:
Put target enchantment on top of its owner's library.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: Every day, Order clerics contain as much of the Mirari's energy as possible, hoping to delay Otaria's demise.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Aurification
card.ability:
Whenever a creature deals damage to you, put a gold counter on it.
Each creature with a gold counter on it is a Wall in addition to its other creature types and has defender. (Those creatures can't attack.)
When Aurification leaves the battlefield, remove all gold counters from all creatures.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Aurification gives the creature type "Wall" to creatures with gold counters on them in addition to granting them defender.

card.name: Avarax
card.ability:
Haste
When Avarax enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Avarax, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{1}{R}: Avarax gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Aven Brigadier
card.ability:
Flying
Other Bird creatures get +1/+1.
Other Soldier creatures get +1/+1.
card.flavor: He represents what little pride the Order has left.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It gives +2/+2 to creatures that are both Birds and Soldiers.

card.name: Aven Fateshaper
card.ability:
Flying
When Aven Fateshaper enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
{4}{U}: Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

card.name: Aven Soulgazer
card.ability:
Flying
{2}{W}: Look at target face-down creature.
card.flavor: "Every question has a proper answer. Every soul has a proper place."

card.name: Backslide
card.ability:
Turn target creature with morph face down.
Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: Some things are better left unknown.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Barkhide Mauler
card.ability: Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: Anywhere else they would be hunted for their skins, but in Wirewood, they are safe.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Barren Moor
card.ability:
Barren Moor enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Battering Craghorn
card.ability:
First strike
Morph {1}{R}{R} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: Their skeletons can be found all over Skirk Ridge, tangled in each other's horns.

card.name: Battlefield Medic
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn, where X is the number of Clerics on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Death never stops to rest. Neither can we."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The value of X is determined when this resolves, not later when damage would be dealt.

card.name: Biorhythm
card.ability: Each player's life total becomes the number of creatures he or she controls.
card.flavor:
"I have seen life's purpose, and now it is my own."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a player controls no creatures when this resolves, their life total will become zero and he or she will lose the game.
10/4/2004 : This spell causes the player to lose or gain enough life to change to the new life total.

card.name: Birchlore Rangers
card.ability:
Tap two untapped Elves you control: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
Morph {G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since the ability does not have the {Tap} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
10/4/2004 : It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

card.name: Blackmail
card.ability: Target player reveals three cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card.
card.flavor: Even the most virtuous person is only one secret away from being owned by the Cabal.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the player has less than 3 cards, all of them are revealed.

card.name: Blatant Thievery
card.ability: For each opponent, gain control of target permanent that player controls. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: "I'll leave subtlety to the rich."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If a permanent changes controller after being targeted but before this spell resolves, you won't gain control of that permanent.
10/4/2004 : You gain control of only one permanent from each player.

card.name: Blistering Firecat
card.ability:
Trample, haste
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Blistering Firecat.
Morph {R}{R} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Bloodline Shaman
card.ability: {T}: Choose a creature type. Reveal the top card of your library. If that card is a creature card of the chosen type, put it into your hand. Otherwise, put it into your graveyard.
card.flavor: Every creature of the forest has a name, and she knows them all.

card.name: Bloodstained Mire
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Bloodstained Mire: Search your library for a Swamp or Mountain card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Boneknitter
card.ability:
{1}{B}: Regenerate target Zombie.
Morph {2}{B} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: Nothing comes together as easily as it comes apart.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can regenerate itself.

card.name: Break Open
card.ability: Turn target face-down creature an opponent controls face up.
card.flavor: There are two ways to resolve puzzling situations: thoughtful contemplation or force. After thoughtful contemplation, most barbarians choose force.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The player does not have to pay the Morph cost (if any) of the creature.

card.name: Brightstone Ritual
card.ability: Add {R} to your mana pool for each Goblin on the battlefield.
card.flavor: Wizards fought over the stone to exploit its power. Goblins fight over it because it's shiny.

card.name: Broodhatch Nantuko
card.ability:
Whenever Broodhatch Nantuko is dealt damage, you may put that many 1/1 green Insect creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Morph {2}{G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can choose to put zero tokens or all the tokens onto the battlefield. You can't choose a number in between.

card.name: Butcher Orgg
card.ability: You may assign Butcher Orgg's combat damage divided as you choose among defending player and/or any number of creatures he or she controls.
card.flavor: It can kill you with three arms tied behind its back.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If it is blocked but then all of its blockers are removed before combat damage is assigned, then it won't be able to deal combat damage and you won't be able to use its ability.
10/4/2004 : You can use the ability to divide damage even if it is not blocked.
10/4/2004 : If you choose to use the ability to divide up the damage (and there is at least one point of damage to be assigned), you must choose at least one creature or the defending player, and can't choose more total creatures and players than the amount of damage being assigned (minimum 1 point per player or creature).

card.name: Cabal Archon
card.ability: {B}, Sacrifice a Cleric: Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: "You are weak. I am strong. The protocol is obvious."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It can sacrifice itself.

card.name: Cabal Executioner
card.ability:
Whenever Cabal Executioner deals combat damage to a player, that player sacrifices a creature.
Morph {3}{B}{B} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Cabal Slaver
card.ability: Whenever a Goblin deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
card.flavor: "In its natural habitat, the goblin is stupid, yet devious. Now it's stupid, devious, and powerful."

card.name: Callous Oppressor
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Callous Oppressor during your untap step.
As Callous Oppressor enters the battlefield, an opponent chooses a creature type.
{T}: Gain control of target creature that isn't of the chosen type for as long as Callous Oppressor remains tapped.

card.name: Catapult Master
card.ability: Tap five untapped Soldiers you control: Exile target creature.
card.flavor: "There's no ‘I' in ‘team,' but there's a ‘we' in ‘weapon.'"
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since the ability does not have the {Tap} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
10/4/2004 : It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

card.name: Catapult Squad
card.ability: Tap two untapped Soldiers you control: Catapult Squad deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: Together they could hit anything between the heavens and the horizon.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since the ability does not have the {Tap} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
10/4/2004 : It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

card.name: Centaur Glade
card.ability: {2}{G}{G}: Put a 3/3 green Centaur creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: The Mirari called to the centaurs, and all who heard it were forever changed.

card.name: Chain of Acid
card.ability: Destroy target noncreature permanent. Then that permanent's controller may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

card.name: Chain of Plasma
card.ability: Chain of Plasma deals 3 damage to target creature or player. Then that player or that creature's controller may discard a card. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

card.name: Chain of Silence
card.ability: Prevent all damage target creature would deal this turn. That creature's controller may sacrifice a land. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

card.name: Chain of Smog
card.ability: Target player discards two cards. That player may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

card.name: Chain of Vapor
card.ability: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. Then that permanent's controller may sacrifice a land. If the player does, he or she may copy this spell and may choose a new target for that copy.

card.name: Charging Slateback
card.ability:
Charging Slateback can't block.
Morph {4}{R} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: Goblins prize its hide for building rock sled runners.

card.name: Choking Tethers
card.ability:
Tap up to four target creatures.
Cycling {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Choking Tethers, you may tap target creature.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
10/1/2008 : You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

card.name: Circle of Solace
card.ability:
As Circle of Solace enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
{1}{W}: The next time a creature of the chosen type would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

card.name: Clone
card.ability: You may have Clone enter the battlefield as a copy of any creature on the battlefield.
card.ruling:
7/15/2007 : If the chosen creature is copying something else (for example, if the chosen creature is another Clone), then your Clone enters the battlefield as whatever the chosen creature copied.
7/15/2007 : If the chosen creature is a token, Clone copies the original characteristics of that token as stated by the effect that put it onto the battlefield. Clone is not a token.
7/15/2007 : Any enters-the-battlefield abilities of the copied creature will trigger when Clone enters the battlefield. Any "as [this creature] enters the battlefield" or "[this creature] enters the battlefield with" abilities of the chosen creature will also work.
10/1/2009 : If the chosen creature has {X} in its mana cost (such as Protean Hydra), X is considered to be zero.
7/1/2012 : Clone copies exactly what was printed on the original creature and nothing more (unless that creature is copying something else or is a token; see below). It doesn't copy whether that creature is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or Auras attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
7/1/2012 : If Clone somehow enters the battlefield at the same time as another creature, Clone can't become a copy of that creature. You may only choose a creature that's already on the battlefield.
7/1/2012 : You can choose not to copy anything. In that case, Clone enters the battlefield as a 0/0 Shapeshifter creature, and is probably put into the graveyard immediately.

card.name: Commando Raid
card.ability: Until end of turn, target creature you control gains "When this creature deals combat damage to a player, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature that player controls."

card.name: Complicate
card.ability:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {3}.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Complicate, you may counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
10/1/2008 : You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

card.name: Contested Cliffs
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{R}{G}, {T}: Choose target Beast creature you control and target creature an opponent controls. Those creatures fight each other. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If either target is illegal when the ability resolves, it will do nothing.

card.name: Convalescent Care
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have 5 or less life, you gain 3 life and draw a card.
card.flavor: Enlightenment comes most swiftly at life's end.

card.name: Cover of Darkness
card.ability:
As Cover of Darkness enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type have fear. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

card.name: Crafty Pathmage
card.ability: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.
card.flavor: The most valuable commodity in the pits is a way out.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you increase the power of the targeted creature after the ability resolves, it will still be unblockable that turn.

card.name: Crowd Favorites
card.ability:
{3}{W}: Tap target creature.
{3}{W}: Crowd Favorites gets +0/+5 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"The rabble likes them. Make sure they win, then book them for tomorrow."
—Cabal Patriarch

card.name: Crown of Ascension
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Sacrifice Crown of Ascension: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it gain flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Wisdom, clear my eyes."

card.name: Crown of Awe
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from black and from red.
Sacrifice Crown of Awe: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it gain protection from black and from red until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Honor, guide my step."

card.name: Crown of Fury
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
Sacrifice Crown of Fury: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it get +1/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Passion, fire my heart."

card.name: Crown of Suspicion
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/-1.
Sacrifice Crown of Suspicion: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it get +2/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Darkness, hide my fear."

card.name: Crown of Vigor
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice Crown of Vigor: Enchanted creature and other creatures that share a creature type with it get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Life, be my shield."

card.name: Crude Rampart
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Morph {4}{W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: Success is one part inspiration, nine parts desperation.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If it attacks while face down and is turned face up during combat, this will not remove it from combat.

card.name: Cruel Revival
card.ability: Destroy target non-Zombie creature. It can't be regenerated. Return up to one target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Few Cabal fighters fear death. They fear what follows it.

card.name: Cryptic Gateway
card.ability: Tap two untapped creatures you control: You may put a creature card from your hand that shares a creature type with each creature tapped this way onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Its lock changes to fit each key.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : For this to be useful, either both creatures have to have a common creature type that the one in your hand also has, or the card in your hand needs to have at least two creature types so each tapped creature can match a different one.

card.name: Custody Battle
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "At the beginning of your upkeep, target opponent gains control of this creature unless you sacrifice a land."
card.flavor: Goblins resolve disputes by splitting everything straight down the middle.

card.name: Daru Cavalier
card.ability:
First strike
When Daru Cavalier enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Daru Cavalier, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

card.name: Daru Encampment
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{W}, {T}: Target Soldier creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Daru Healer
card.ability:
{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Morph {W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Daru Lancer
card.ability:
First strike
Morph {2}{W}{W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: Although the Order frowned upon his preparations for the pits, behind closed doors most saw the fights as a necessary evil.

card.name: Daunting Defender
card.ability: If a source would deal damage to a Cleric creature you control, prevent 1 of that damage.
card.flavor: "I will wield the stone of my homeland as though it were the fists of the Ancestor."

card.name: Dawning Purist
card.ability:
Whenever Dawning Purist deals combat damage to a player, you may destroy target enchantment that player controls.
Morph {1}{W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Death Match
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, that creature's controller may have target creature of his or her choice get -3/-3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The Cabal breeds many things for the pit fights, but it never breeds compassion.

card.name: Death Pulse
card.ability:
Target creature gets -4/-4 until end of turn.
Cycling {1}{B}{B} ({1}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Death Pulse, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
10/1/2008 : You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

card.name: Defensive Maneuvers
card.ability: Creatures of the creature type of your choice get +0/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Only on the battlefield can we repay all the Order has given us."

card.name: Demystify
card.ability: Destroy target enchantment.
card.flavor: "The truth will outshine all lies."

card.name: Dirge of Dread
card.ability:
All creatures gain fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Cycling {1}{B} ({1}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Dirge of Dread, you may have target creature gain fear until end of turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
10/1/2008 : You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

card.name: Disciple of Grace
card.ability:
Protection from black
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: Dread was as foreign to her as the landscape ahead.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Disciple of Malice
card.ability:
Protection from white
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: The lantern he carried did not light his way—it signaled his approach.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Discombobulate
card.ability: Counter target spell. Look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
card.flavor:
"I said ‘pick his brain,' not ‘tear off his head.'"
—Riptide Project researcher

card.name: Dispersing Orb
card.ability: {3}{U}, Sacrifice a permanent: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor:
"Like the seas, the Æther is fickle and ever-changing. If we can control one, we can master the other."
—Riptide Project director

card.name: Disruptive Pitmage
card.ability:
{T}: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {1}.
Morph {U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: "Show weakness to hide your strength."

card.name: Dive Bomber
card.ability:
Flying
{T}, Sacrifice Dive Bomber: Dive Bomber deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor: "Your graves will lie beneath my final nest."

card.name: Doom Cannon
card.ability:
As Doom Cannon enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature of the chosen type: Doom Cannon deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Doomed Necromancer
card.ability: {B}, {T}, Sacrifice Doomed Necromancer: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
card.flavor:
"His sacrifice shall not be forgotten. Now toss his body over there with the others."
—Phage the Untouchable

card.name: Doubtless One
card.ability:
Doubtless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Clerics on the battlefield.
Whenever Doubtless One deals damage, you gain that much life.
card.flavor: "Share your devotion with me."

card.name: Dragon Roost
card.ability: {5}{R}{R}: Put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: A powerful mage created the roost to guard a portal between the planes. The mage is long gone, but dragons still keep watch at the gate.

card.name: Dream Chisel
card.ability: Face-down creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
card.flavor: Itself a product of Ixidor's tortured psyche, the chisel brings his darkest dreams to life.

card.name: Dwarven Blastminer
card.ability:
{2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.
Morph {R} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: "Life is too short for something like a hunk of rock to get in my way."

card.name: Ebonblade Reaper
card.ability:
Whenever Ebonblade Reaper attacks, you lose half your life, rounded up.
Whenever Ebonblade Reaper deals combat damage to a player, that player loses half his or her life, rounded up.
Morph {3}{B}{B} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.ruling: 2/1/2007 : If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0.  This means that the life total stays the same.  A life total of -10 would remain -10.

card.name: Elven Riders
card.ability: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
card.flavor: "Wirewood cannot hide great size. Only with speed and skill can we survive here."
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don’t actually have Flying, so they can’t block this.

card.name: Elvish Guidance
card.ability:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool for each Elf on the battlefield (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.flavor: "Old home never forgotten, new home ours forever."

card.name: Elvish Pathcutter
card.ability: {2}{G}: Target Elf creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.
card.flavor: In harsh times, the strongest currency is cooperation.

card.name: Elvish Pioneer
card.ability: When Elvish Pioneer enters the battlefield, you may put a basic land card from your hand onto the battlefield tapped.
card.flavor:
"Destruction is the work of an afternoon. Creation is the work of a lifetime."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

card.name: Elvish Scrapper
card.ability: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Scrapper: Destroy target artifact.
card.flavor: "The stories tell of a distant time when machines overran the forests, destroying everything that lived. That time will not come again."

card.name: Elvish Vanguard
card.ability: Whenever another Elf enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Vanguard.
card.flavor: "Our lives are woven together like the trees' branches over our heads, forming a canopy that protects us all."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If this card enters the battlefield at the same time as another Elf, the ability will trigger due to that Elf.

card.name: Elvish Warrior
card.flavor: "My tales of war are the stories most asked for around the fires at night, but they're the ones I care least to tell."

card.name: Embermage Goblin
card.ability:
When Embermage Goblin enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a card named Embermage Goblin, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{T}: Embermage Goblin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Enchantress's Presence
card.ability: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, draw a card.
card.flavor: "The wise learn from successes as well as mistakes."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It does not trigger for itself being cast.

card.name: Endemic Plague
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Endemic Plague, sacrifice a creature.
Destroy all creatures that share a creature type with the sacrificed creature. They can't be regenerated.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Entrails Feaster
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile a creature card from a graveyard. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on Entrails Feaster. If you don't, tap Entrails Feaster.

card.name: Erratic Explosion
card.ability: Choose target creature or player. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Erratic Explosion deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that creature or player. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If all your cards are lands, no damage is dealt.

card.name: Essence Fracture
card.ability:
Return two target creatures to their owners' hands.
Cycling {2}{U} ({2}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor:
"Shaping reality is simply a matter of knowing where to apply pressure."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Everglove Courier
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Everglove Courier during your untap step.
{2}{G}, {T}: Target Elf creature gets +2/+2 and has trample for as long as Everglove Courier remains tapped.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It checks the creature type when the ability is announced and resolved, but once the effect is placed on the creature, if its creature type changes the effect still continues.

card.name: Exalted Angel
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Exalted Angel deals damage, you gain that much life.
Morph {2}{W}{W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

card.name: Explosive Vegetation
card.ability: Search your library for up to two basic land cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: Torching Krosa would be pointless. It grows faster than it burns.

card.name: Fade from Memory
card.ability:
Exile target card from a graveyard.
Cycling {B} ({B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: Proper burial is a luxury Otarians can no longer afford.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Fallen Cleric
card.ability:
Protection from Clerics
Morph {4}{B} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: The most terrifying zombies are those with just a hint of their old selves left.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Protection from clerics prevents damage from cleric sources, can't have any clerics assigned to block it, and can't be targeted by the abilities of clerics.

card.name: False Cure
card.ability: Until end of turn, whenever a player gains life, that player loses 2 life for each 1 life he or she gained.
card.flavor:
"I do unto others as others have done unto me."
—Phage the Untouchable

card.name: Feeding Frenzy
card.ability: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Zombies on the battlefield.
card.flavor: It wasn't as much a strategy as a dim instinct to drown their prey.

card.name: Festering Goblin
card.ability: When Festering Goblin dies, target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: In life, it was a fetid, disease-ridden thing. In death, not much changed.

card.name: Fever Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Target creature gains haste until end of turn; or target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn; or Fever Charm deals 3 damage to target Wizard creature.

card.name: Flamestick Courier
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Flamestick Courier during your untap step.
{2}{R}, {T}: Target Goblin creature gets +2/+2 and has haste for as long as Flamestick Courier remains tapped.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It checks the creature type when the ability is announced and resolved, but once the effect is placed on the creature, if its creature type changes the effect still continues.

card.name: Fleeting Aven
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a player cycles a card, return Fleeting Aven to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: "Don't become so enthralled with magic that you forget you can fly without it."

card.name: Flooded Strand
card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Flooded Strand: Search your library for a Plains or Island card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Foothill Guide
card.ability:
Protection from Goblins
Morph {W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: "Like any pests, goblins must be repelled quickly or they multiply."

card.name: Forgotten Cave
card.ability:
Forgotten Cave enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Frightshroud Courier
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Frightshroud Courier during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Target Zombie creature gets +2/+2 and has fear for as long as Frightshroud Courier remains tapped. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It checks the creature type when the ability is announced and resolved, but once the effect is placed on the creature, if its creature type changes the effect still continues.

card.name: Future Sight
card.ability:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.
You may play the top card of your library.
card.flavor:
"My past holds only pain and loss. I will conquer it by creating the perfect future."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor
card.ruling:
5/1/2007 : The top card of your library isn't in your hand, so you can't suspend it, cycle it, discard it, or activate any of its activated abilities.
5/1/2007 : If the top card of your library is a land, you can play it if you could play a land.
5/1/2007 : If the top card of your library has morph, you can cast that card face down for {3}. However, all players will have seen which card it is before the spell is cast.
5/1/2007 : As soon as you finish playing the card on top of your library, reveal the next card in your library.
5/1/2007 : If the top card of your library changes while you're casting a spell or activating an ability, the new top card won't be revealed until you finish casting that spell or activating that ability.

card.name: Gangrenous Goliath
card.ability: Tap three untapped Clerics you control: Return Gangrenous Goliath from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Cabal clerics don't heal the sick—they heal the dead.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability can only be activated while this card is in your graveyard.

card.name: Ghosthelm Courier
card.ability:
You may choose not to untap Ghosthelm Courier during your untap step.
{2}{U}, {T}: Target Wizard creature gets +2/+2 and has shroud for as long as Ghosthelm Courier remains tapped. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It checks the creature type when the ability is announced and resolved, but once the effect is placed on the creature, if its creature type changes the effect still continues.

card.name: Gigapede
card.ability:
Shroud (This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, if Gigapede is in your graveyard, you may discard a card. If you do, return Gigapede to your hand.

card.name: Glarecaster
card.ability:
Flying
{5}{W}: The next time damage would be dealt to Glarecaster and/or you this turn, that damage is dealt to target creature or player instead.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If both you and this card would be dealt damage at the same time, or if either you or this card would be dealt damage from multiple sources at the same time, the redirection will apply to both chunks of damage.

card.name: Glory Seeker
card.flavor: The turning of the tide always begins with one soldier's decision to head back into the fray.

card.name: Gluttonous Zombie
card.ability: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: Greed and gluttony led him to death. Now they are his greatest assets.

card.name: Goblin Burrows
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{R}, {T}: Target Goblin creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Goblin Machinist
card.ability: {2}{R}: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Goblin Machinist gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost. Put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If all the cards in your library are lands, X is zero.

card.name: Goblin Piledriver
card.ability:
Protection from blue
Whenever Goblin Piledriver attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Goblin.
card.flavor: Throw enough goblins at any problem and it should go away. At the very least, there'll be fewer goblins.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The number of Goblins is counted when this ability resolves.

card.name: Goblin Pyromancer
card.ability:
When Goblin Pyromancer enters the battlefield, Goblin creatures get +3/+0 until end of turn.
At the beginning of the end step, destroy all Goblins.
card.flavor: "The good news is, we figured out how the wand works. The bad news is, we figured out how the wand works."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It only destroys goblins if it is on the battlefield at the end of turn.

card.name: Goblin Sharpshooter
card.ability:
Goblin Sharpshooter doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever a creature dies, untap Goblin Sharpshooter.
{T}: Goblin Sharpshooter deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

card.name: Goblin Sky Raider
card.ability: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
card.flavor: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."

card.name: Goblin Sledder
card.ability: Sacrifice a Goblin: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Let's play ‘sled.' Here's how it works: you're the sled."

card.name: Goblin Taskmaster
card.ability:
{1}{R}: Target Goblin creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Morph {R} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: For some reason, goblin fighting school isn't as crowded on day two.

card.name: Grand Coliseum
card.ability:
Grand Coliseum enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Grand Coliseum deals 1 damage to you.

card.name: Grand Melee
card.ability:
All creatures attack each turn if able.
All creatures block each turn if able.
card.flavor: Hot blood washes away cold reason.

card.name: Grassland Crusader
card.ability: {T}: Target Elf or Soldier creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "Everyone deserves a chance to live. My job is to make sure they get it."

card.name: Gratuitous Violence
card.ability: If a creature you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.
card.flavor: Only the Cabal could make a fight to the death more deadly.

card.name: Gravel Slinger
card.ability:
{T}: Gravel Slinger deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.
Morph {1}{W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Gravespawn Sovereign
card.ability: Tap five untapped Zombies you control: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
card.flavor: The Cabal never expected its creations to create servants of their own.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Since the ability does not have the {Tap} symbol, you can use the ability before this creature begins a turn under your control.
10/4/2004 : It can tap itself but is not required to do so.

card.name: Graxiplon
card.ability: Graxiplon is unblockable unless defending player controls three or more creatures that share a creature type.
card.flavor:
"Attempts to revive this ancient species have not been entirely successful, but results indicate potential for future development."
—Riptide Project researcher

card.name: Grinning Demon
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.
Morph {2}{B}{B} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: It's drawn to the scent of screaming.

card.name: Gustcloak Harrier
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Gustcloak Harrier becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.
card.flavor: Banking steeply, the aven streaked toward the ground—and vanished.

card.name: Gustcloak Runner
card.ability: Whenever Gustcloak Runner becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.
card.flavor: Cabal spies trying to follow the Order's movements are constantly frustrated by tracks that stop dead.

card.name: Gustcloak Savior
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, you may untap that creature and remove it from combat.
card.flavor:
"Our death-arrows flew in high arcs towards the aven. And then . . . nothing."
—Coliseum guard

card.name: Gustcloak Sentinel
card.ability: Whenever Gustcloak Sentinel becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.
card.flavor: Entire platoons have mysteriously vanished from battle, leaving enemy weapons to slice through empty air.

card.name: Gustcloak Skirmisher
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Gustcloak Skirmisher becomes blocked, you may untap it and remove it from combat.
card.flavor: They're trained in the art of pressing their luck.

card.name: Harsh Mercy
card.ability: Each player chooses a creature type. Destroy all creatures that aren't of a type chosen this way. They can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"There is no greater burden than choosing who to save."
—Kamahl, druid acolyte

card.name: Haunted Cadaver
card.ability:
Whenever Haunted Cadaver deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, that player discards three cards.
Morph {1}{B} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Head Games
card.ability: Target opponent puts the cards from his or her hand on top of his or her library. Search that player's library for that many cards. The player puts those cards into his or her hand, then shuffles his or her library.

card.name: Headhunter
card.ability:
Whenever Headhunter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Morph {B} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Heedless One
card.ability:
Trample
Heedless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Channel your vitality through me."

card.name: Hystrodon
card.ability:
Trample
Whenever Hystrodon deals combat damage to a player, you may draw a card.
Morph {1}{G}{G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Imagecrafter
card.ability: {T}: Choose a creature type other than Wall. Target creature becomes that type until end of turn.
card.flavor: When Otarians learned not to trust wizards, the wizards learned to adapt.

card.name: Improvised Armor
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+5.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: "I trust what I make for myself. Do you trust more what is made for you by another?"
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Infest
card.ability: All creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"It is from Phage that this evil springs, and to her it shall return."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

card.name: Information Dealer
card.ability: {T}: Look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the number of Wizards on the battlefield, then put them back in any order.
card.flavor:
"One wizard is a suspect. Two wizards are a conspiracy."
—Elvish refugee

card.name: Inspirit
card.ability: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "We will force the Cabal into their own pits"

card.name: Insurrection
card.ability: Untap all creatures and gain control of them until end of turn. They gain haste until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"Maybe they wanted to be on the winning side for once."
—Matoc, lavamancer
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You untap all creatures, control all creatures, and give all creatures Haste.

card.name: Invigorating Boon
card.ability: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor: The Mirari's echoes rang in the scouts' minds long after they had returned from the Krosan Forest.

card.name: Ironfist Crusher
card.ability:
Ironfist Crusher can block any number of creatures.
Morph {3}{W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Ixidor, Reality Sculptor
card.ability:
Face-down creatures get +1/+1.
{2}{U}: Turn target face-down creature face up.
card.flavor: "Reality has exiled me. I am no longer bound by its laws."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : When you turn a card face up, its controller does not have to pay its Morph cost.

card.name: Ixidor's Will
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2} for each Wizard on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Some dreams should not come to be."

card.name: Jareth, Leonine Titan
card.ability:
Whenever Jareth, Leonine Titan blocks, it gets +7/+7 until end of turn.
{W}: Jareth gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: Light's champion in the stronghold of darkness.

card.name: Kaboom!
card.ability: Choose any number of target players. For each of those players, reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a nonland card. Kaboom deals damage equal to that card's converted mana cost to that player, then you put the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If all the cards in your library are lands, this card deals zero damage.
10/4/2004 : If you target more than one player, you do the whole thing for each player and you do each player in turn order.

card.name: Kamahl, Fist of Krosa
card.ability:
{G}: Target land becomes a 1/1 creature until end of turn. It's still a land.
{2}{G}{G}{G}: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: "My mind has changed. My strength has not."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The second ability only applies to creatures you control at the time it resolves.
10/4/2004 : The Legend rule only applies to two Legends with identical names. If the names are similar, but different, the rule does not apply.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Kamahl's Summons
card.ability: Each player may reveal any number of creature cards from his or her hand. Then each player puts a 2/2 green Bear creature token onto the battlefield for each card he or she revealed this way.
card.flavor: As Krosa unleashed the peace in Kamahl, he unleashed the fury in Krosa.

card.name: Krosan Colossus
card.ability: Morph {6}{G}{G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: When it walked, it altered geography. When it bellowed, it changed the weather.

card.name: Krosan Groundshaker
card.ability: {G}: Target Beast creature gains trample until end of turn.
card.flavor: You know it's coming when you hear the distant thunder. You know where it's been when you see the path of broken trees.

card.name: Krosan Tusker
card.ability:
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Krosan Tusker, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

card.name: Lavamancer's Skill
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature."
As long as enchanted creature is a Wizard, it has "{T}: This creature deals 2 damage to target creature."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If this card enchants a Wizard, the Wizard has both abilities and its controller can use either one.

card.name: Lay Waste
card.ability:
Destroy target land.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: Skirk Ridge had survived earthquakes, mudslides, and meteor showers. Then the goblins moved in.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Leery Fogbeast
card.ability: Whenever Leery Fogbeast becomes blocked, prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
card.flavor: It emerges from the mists only to feed.

card.name: Lightning Rift
card.ability: Whenever a player cycles a card, you may pay {1}. If you do, Lightning Rift deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Options will cost you, but a lack of them will cost you even more.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You choose the target when this ability is put on the stack, but you do not decide whether or not to pay the mana until the ability resolves.

card.name: Lonely Sandbar
card.ability:
Lonely Sandbar enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Mage's Guile
card.ability:
Target creature gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Cycling {U} ({U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: "Next time, don't bother."
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Mana Echoes
card.ability: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, you may add {X} to your mana pool, where X is the number of creatures you control that share a creature type with it.
card.flavor: When the ground is saturated with mana, even the lightest footstep can bring it to the surface.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You either get zero mana or all the mana. You can't choose an amount in between.
10/4/2004 : You do get to count the creature itself, you even get one mana if it is the only creature you have on the battlefield (assuming it has at least one creature type).

card.name: Meddle
card.ability: If target spell has only one target and that target is a creature, change that spell's target to another creature.
card.flavor: Strength may win the fight, but style wins the crowd.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Only works on spells with a single target, where that target is a creature. Will not work on spells that target a single creature and a player, for example.

card.name: Menacing Ogre
card.ability:
Trample, haste
When Menacing Ogre enters the battlefield, each player secretly chooses a number. Then those numbers are revealed. Each player with the highest number loses that much life. If you are one of those players, put two +1/+1 counters on Menacing Ogre.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You have to choose zero or a positive number. It must be an integer number.

card.name: Misery Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Destroy target Cleric; or return target Cleric card from your graveyard to your hand; or target player loses 2 life.

card.name: Mistform Dreamer
card.ability:
Flying
{1}: Mistform Dreamer becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: Devotion, the second myth of reality: The faithful are most hurt by the objects of their faith.

card.name: Mistform Mask
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{1}: Enchanted creature becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: Trust, the fifth myth of reality: Every truth holds the seed of betrayal.

card.name: Mistform Mutant
card.ability: {1}{U}: Choose a creature type other than Wall. Target creature becomes that type until end of turn.
card.flavor: Familiarity, the first myth of reality: What you know the best, you observe the least.

card.name: Mistform Shrieker
card.ability:
Flying
{1}: Mistform Shrieker becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
Morph {3}{U}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Mistform Skyreaver
card.ability:
Flying
{1}: Mistform Skyreaver becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: Conviction, the third myth of reality: Only those who seek the truth can be deceived.

card.name: Mistform Stalker
card.ability:
{1}: Mistform Stalker becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
{2}{U}{U}: Mistform Stalker gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Mistform Wall
card.ability:
Mistform Wall has defender as long as it's a Wall.
{1}: Mistform Wall becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: Fellowship, the fourth myth of reality: As the tides of war shift, so do loyalties.

card.name: Mobilization
card.ability:
Soldier creatures have vigilance. (Attacking doesn't cause them to tap.)
{2}{W}: Put a 1/1 white Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: Newcomers to Otaria find themselves at the bottom of the heap. In the pits, they at least have the chance to climb atop a heap of bodies.

card.name: Mythic Proportions
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +8/+8 and has trample.
card.flavor: The blood of Krosa turns rational beings into primal forces.

card.name: Nameless One
card.ability:
Nameless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Wizards on the battlefield.
Morph {2}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: "Open your mind to me."

card.name: Nantuko Husk
card.ability: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace.
—Nantuko teaching

card.name: Naturalize
card.ability: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
card.flavor: "From here, let the world be reborn."

card.name: Nosy Goblin
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice Nosy Goblin: Destroy target face-down creature.
card.flavor: To his surprise, Furt discovered that the strange creatures were not at all like bugs.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the target is turned face up before the ability resolves, the creature is no longer a legal target and is not destroyed.

card.name: Nova Cleric
card.ability: {2}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Nova Cleric: Destroy all enchantments.
card.flavor: "Our noblest thoughts are our very first and our very last."

card.name: Oblation
card.ability: The owner of target nonland permanent shuffles it into his or her library, then draws two cards.
card.flavor: "A richer people could give more but they could never give as much."

card.name: Oversold Cemetery
card.ability: At the beginning of your upkeep, if you have four or more creature cards in your graveyard, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The check for four or more creature cards is performed on resolution as well as at the beginning of upkeep. So the trigger may not do anything if there are not enough creatures any longer.

card.name: Overwhelming Instinct
card.ability: Whenever you attack with three or more creatures, draw a card.
card.flavor: The biggest difference between a victory and a massacre is which side you're on.

card.name: Pacifism
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
card.flavor: Even those born to battle could only lay their blades at Akroma's feet.

card.name: Patriarch's Bidding
card.ability: Each player chooses a creature type. Each player returns all creature cards of a type chosen this way from his or her graveyard to the battlefield.

"Family plots are so convenient."
—Cabal Patriarch

You may choose not to untap Pearlspear Courier during your untap step.

card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It checks the creature type when the ability is announced and resolved, but once the effect is placed on the creature, if its creature type changes the effect still continues.

card.ability: Choose a creature type. If you control more creatures of that type than each other player, you gain control of all creatures of that type. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

card.name: Piety Charm
card.ability: Choose one — Destroy target Aura attached to a creature; or target Soldier creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn; or creatures you control gain vigilance until end of turn.

card.ability: {T}, Pay 1 life, Sacrifice Polluted Delta: Search your library for an Island or Swamp card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

card.ability:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Cycling {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Primal Boost, you may have target creature get +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Profane Prayers
card.ability: Profane Prayers deals X damage to target creature or player and you gain X life, where X is the number of Clerics on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "We have ways to make you talk, but you have nothing interesting to say."

card.name: Prowling Pangolin
card.ability: When Prowling Pangolin enters the battlefield, any player may sacrifice two creatures. If a player does, sacrifice Prowling Pangolin.

card.name: Psychic Trance
card.ability: Until end of turn, Wizards you control gain "{T}: Counter target spell."

card.name: Quicksilver Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{U}: If target spell has only one target and that target is Quicksilver Dragon, change that spell's target to another creature.

"All we know about the Krosan Forest we have learned from those few who made it out alive."

card.flavor: "The world is a puzzle, and the mind is its key."
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You are never forced to sacrifice any permanents. You can choose to discard your entire hand if your hand is smaller than the number of cards you are required to discard.
10/4/2004 : You draw the cards, then sacrifice any permanents you want to sacrifice, then discard the required number of card from your hand. There is no chance to play any cards in between these actions.

card.name: Reckless One
card.ability:
Haste
Reckless One's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Goblins on the battlefield.
card.flavor: "Release chaos with me"

card.name: Reminisce
card.ability: Target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library.
card.flavor: "Leave the door to the past even slightly ajar and it could be blown off its hinges."

card.name: Renewed Faith
card.ability:
You gain 6 life.
Cycling {1}{W} ({1}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Renewed Faith, you may gain 2 life.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

card.name: Righteous Cause
card.ability: Whenever a creature attacks, you gain 1 life.
card.flavor:
"Until the world unites in vengeful fury and Phage is destroyed, I will not stay my hand."
—Akroma, angelic avenger

card.name: Riptide Biologist
card.ability:
Protection from Beasts
Morph {2}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: "I gave it two choices: life in the lab or death in the hunt."

card.name: Riptide Chronologist
card.ability: {U}, Sacrifice Riptide Chronologist: Untap all creatures of the creature type of your choice.
card.flavor: The wizard consulted the Riptide Project about how to further his research. He wasn't prepared for what they told him.

card.name: Riptide Entrancer
card.ability:
Whenever Riptide Entrancer deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice it. If you do, gain control of target creature that player controls. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
Morph {U}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}{U}, {T}: Return target Wizard you control to its owner's hand.

As Riptide Replicator enters the battlefield, choose a color and a creature type.
Riptide Replicator enters the battlefield with X charge counters on it.
{4}, {T}: Put an X/X creature token of the chosen color and type onto the battlefield, where X is the number of charge counters on Riptide Replicator.

card.ability: {2}{U}{U}, Sacrifice Riptide Shapeshifter: Choose a creature type. Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a creature card of that type. Put that card onto the battlefield and shuffle the rest into your library.

card.ability:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player gains control of Risky Move.
When you gain control of Risky Move from another player, choose a creature you control and an opponent. Flip a coin. If you lose the flip, that opponent gains control of that creature.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The change of control of creatures does not end at end of turn or even when this card leaves the battlefield.
10/4/2004 : This card does not target any creatures or players.

card.name: Rorix Bladewing
card.ability: Flying, haste
card.flavor: In the smoldering ashes of Shiv, a few dragons strive to rebuild their native land. The rest seek any opportunity to restore the broken pride of their race.

card.name: Rotlung Reanimator
card.ability: Whenever Rotlung Reanimator or another Cleric dies, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Rummaging Wizard
card.ability: {2}{U}: Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
card.flavor: "I've got everything you'd ever need right here. Just give me some time to find it."

card.name: Run Wild
card.ability: Until end of turn, target creature gains trample and "{G}: Regenerate this creature."
card.flavor: Wirewood's beasts didn't seem to mind when the elves moved in. In fact, they hardly noticed them underfoot.

card.name: Sage Aven
card.ability:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Sage Aven enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.

card.name: Sandskin
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

card.name: Screaming Seahawk
card.ability:
Flying

card.name: Screeching Buzzard
card.ability:
Flying
When Screeching Buzzard dies, each opponent discards a card.

card.name: Searing Flesh
card.ability: Searing Flesh deals 7 damage to target opponent.
card.flavor: Zemoo found out the hard way that "inflammable" and "flammable" mean the same thing.

card.name: Sea's Claim
card.ability:
Enchant land (Target a land as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that land.)
Enchanted land is an Island.
card.flavor:
"My vengeance will drown my enemies as my storms drown the desert."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

card.name: Seaside Haven
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{W}{U}, {T}, Sacrifice a Bird: Draw a card.

card.name: Secluded Steppe
card.ability:
Secluded Steppe enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
Cycling {W} ({W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

card.name: Serpentine Basilisk
card.ability:
Whenever Serpentine Basilisk deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
Morph {1}{G}{G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Severed Legion
card.ability: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: No one in Aphetto answers a knock at the door after sundown.

card.name: Shade's Breath
card.ability: Until end of turn, each creature you control becomes a black Shade and gains "{B}: This creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn."
card.flavor: The grim business of the Coliseum casts long shadows.

card.name: Shaleskin Bruiser
card.ability:
Trample
Whenever Shaleskin Bruiser attacks, it gets +3/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Beast.
card.flavor: Its only predators are the elements.

card.name: Shared Triumph
card.ability:
As Shared Triumph enters the battlefield, choose a creature type.
Creatures of the chosen type get +1/+1.

—Cabal Patriarch

card.ability:
Tap two untapped Clerics you control: Prevent all damage target creature would deal this turn.
Tap two untapped Wizards you control: Prevent all damage target spell would deal this turn.
card.flavor: "You may fight if I deem your cause worthy."

10/4/2004 : If the ability is activated targeting a spell that becomes a permanent, it also prevents any damage from that permanent this turn.
